14.6. Recurrent Neural Network Models 282
Listing 14.52: Example of reshaping input data for the ConvLSTM model.
The shape is ﬁve-dimensional, with the dimensions: [samples, subsequences, rows,
columns, features].
Like the CNN, the ConvLSTM layer allows us to specify the number of ﬁlter maps and the
size of the kernel used when reading the input sequences.
# define convlstm layer
model.add(ConvLSTM2D(filters=n_filters, kernel_size=(1,n_kernel), activation=' relu' ,
